page.title: 09ECOLOGY
page.content: Gartly experiences slightly cooler temperatures than those in the Huntly area. The hills on either side of the Bogie tend to funnel the wind. Conversely on calm days summer mists lie an hour or so longer when there is a high pressure with the wind from the east. In winter the high-ground roads block easily but the main road within this particular block remains relatively clear. The lowest recorded temperature at mid-day in the school Stevenson screen in term time for the winter 1984/85 (for us a mild winter) was -5 degrees C. on 25th January 1985. The highest reading at mid-day was 25 C. on 20th August 1984.
